intro: Stachytarpheta hirsutissima, commonly known as the hairy verbena, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and spikes of tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its showy inflorescences, which range in color from blue to purple, attract a variety of pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Stachytarpheta hirsutissima is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
